tool_description: API that provides information schedules about movies showing in Kenyan cinemas
name: Movie Max
title: Movie Max

api_list.name: /v1/configuration
api_list.description: Get the system wide configuration information. Some elements of the API require some knowledge of this configuration data. The purpose of this is to try and keep the actual API responses as light as possible. It is recommended you cache this data within your application and check for updates every few days. This method currently holds the data relevant to building image URLs. To build an image URL, you will need 3 pieces of data. The base_url, size and file_path. Simply combine them all and you will have a fully qualified URL. Here’s an example URL: http://image.tmdb.org/t/p/w500/8uO0gUM8aNqYLs1OsTBQiXu0fEv.jpg
api_list.code:
import requests

url = "https://joseph-n-movie-max-v1.p.rapidapi.com/v1/configuration"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "joseph-n-movie-max-v1.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())

api_list.name: Movie
api_list.description: Get movie information for a particular movie. You must provide the movie id

api_list.name: All Theatres
api_list.description: Get a list of all currently supported theatres by the API
api_list.code:

url = "https://joseph-n-movie-max-v1.p.rapidapi.com/v1/theatres"

headers = {

            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "joseph-n-movie-max-v1.p.rapidapi.com"

api_list.name: Schedules
api_list.description: Get showtimes of a particular movie in a particular theatre. You will need to pass in the theatre's id and the movie id. The result is a list of showtimes that the movie is showing

api_list.name: Theatres
api_list.description: Get a list of theatres that a particular movie is showing in.

api_list.name: Upcoming
api_list.description: Get a list of upcoming movies across all theatres
api_list.code:

url = "https://joseph-n-movie-max-v1.p.rapidapi.com/v1/movies/upcoming"

        }

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)

api_list.name: Movies
api_list.description: Get a list of movies showing in a particular theatre. You will need to pass in the theatre's id which you get when you get in the previous step

api_list.name: All Schedules
api_list.description: Accessing this enpoints returns a list of dates in which movies are showing across all theatres. To get a list of movies you must use the format of the dates AS IS in this list

api_list.name: Movies Showing
api_list.description: Get a list of theatres with respective movies that are showing on the specified date plus their showtimes on that date. The format must be in dd-mm-yyyy. Essentially the date variable should be any date returned in /schedules otherwise you will get empty results

optional_parameters.name: theatre_id
optional_parameters.description: The id of the theatre you want to filter the results with

api_list.name: All Movies
api_list.description: Get a list of movies showing across all theatres
